intro: Hibbertia cunninghamii var. hastata, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open forests and heathlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
